availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William H. Woodcock (Pulaski County, Kentucky, cabinetmaker, quartermaster (U.S.A.) )

body.p: Pulaski County, Kentucky, cabinetmaker, quartermaster (U.S.A.). Pulaski County, Kentucky, cabinetmaker and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Sarah Woodcock. Cabinetmaker in 1850. Served as quartermaster for the 43rd Regiment Kentucky Volunteer Regiment in Frankfort, and subsequently, for the 32nd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment from November 26, 1862 until his resignation on June 3, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pulaski County, p. 7
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pulaski County, p. 4
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 302.
